com.noctarius.borabora

Interface Input

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompositeBuffer

    public interface Input
    An Input instance represents a source for readable data. Input implementations are stateless and thread-safe by design. They also have to support random access based on offsets.

    A common basic example for the usage of Input looks like:

     Input input = Input.fromByteArray( ... );
 Parser parser = Parser.newBuilder().build();
 Query query = Query.newBuilder().build();
 Value value = parser.read( input, query );
    See Also:
    Value, Query, Parser

    • Method Detail

      • read

        byte read(long offset)
   throws NoSuchByteException
        Reads a single byte at the given offset from the underlying stream. If the offset is outside the readable area a NoSuchByteException is thrown. Otherwise the byte is returned.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset to read from
        Returns:
        the byte at the given offset
        Throws:
        NoSuchByteException - if offset is outside the readable area

      • read

        long read(byte[] bytes,
          long offset,
          int length)
   throws NoSuchByteException
        Reads zero or more bytes defined by the given length. Data is read into the given byte-array (bytes) and reading starts at the provided offset. If offset or offset plus length results in an offset larger than the readable area, or length is larger then the given byte-array's length, a NoSuchByteException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to read to
        offset - the offset to start reading
        length - the number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        returns the number of byte read
        Throws:
        NoSuchByteException - if offset, offset+length is outside the readable area or length is larger than the provided byte array

      • offsetValid

        boolean offsetValid(long offset)
        Returns true if the given offset is inside the readable area, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        offset - offset to validate
        Returns:
        true if offset is valid, otherwise false

      • fromByteArray

        static Input fromByteArray(byte[] bytes)
        Returns an Input instance backed by the provided bytes byte-array. The instance returned does not handle offsets larger than Integer.MAX_VALUE due to the limitation of Java. All offsets larger will result in an IllegalArgumentException being thrown.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to be used as the backing storage for the new input instance
        Returns:
        the new input instance backed by the given byte-array

      • fromNative

        static Input fromNative(long address,
                        long size)
        Returns an Input instance backed by the provided address which represents a native memory address and the given size for the number of available bytes. The instance returned is implemented using Unsafe to provide native memory access and to provide 64 bit offsets. Not all JVMs support this kind of access and therefore it might fail to be used.
        Parameters:
        address - the native memory address of the data
        size - the number of bytes of the available data
        Returns:
        the new input instance backed by the given address and size

      • fromCompositeBuffer

        static Input fromCompositeBuffer(CompositeBuffer compositeBuffer)
        Returns an Input instance backed by the provided compositeBuffer. The CompositeBuffer is implemented as a linked list of byte-array's called chunks. The buffer is automatically growing and prevents recreation and copying of internal byte-arrays. This makes it fast for writing, however the single linked list design makes random access read access slow. That said, a CompositeBuffer is good for writing if the resulting stream size is unknown but should only be used for reading in rare cases.
        Parameters:
        compositeBuffer - the CompositeBuffer to read from
        Returns:
        the new input instance backed by the given compositeBuffer
        See Also:
        CompositeBuffer
